Consistency Map: (1) Repeated laptop+phone mock assemblies, (2) caption block under each tile, (3) alternating tile sizes (half vs full width). Failure Theme: Device‑mock collage with tiny UI and mismatched mats drives rhythm flicker; billboard tile overwhelms the grid; logos behind the footer add visual noise. Anchor Comparison: Nearest is Exemplar 8 (cleaner two‑column system with coherent mats). Deltas: here the mocks are unreadable, heights vary more, and the billboard breaks vertical rhythm. Versus Exemplar 19 (tidy card grid), this page lacks unified card mats and disciplined caption alignment. Score Justification: Red‑flag sloppy_images applies (multiple unreadable device mocks, mismatched mats/gradients causing rhythm/value flicker). Per rules, Layout is capped at 2, which matches the observed issues.

color.explanation: Observations: • Neutral white hero with black text; project tiles introduce saturated backgrounds (orange gradients, cyan/blue gradients, deep navy GAP block). • A heavy black footer anchors the bottom. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): No evident single accent; palette is driven by client artwork. Neutrals are untuned (pure white/black look likely); no border/shadow tint system to harmonize imagery. The varied tile backgrounds create value and hue jumps across adjacent tiles. Link/State Audit: Links don’t show a consistent accent or state styling; footer links are just white on black. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated warm/cool gradient mats, (2) white hero, (3) black footer. Failure Theme: Value flicker from disparate mats (orange vs cyan vs navy) with no chromatic unifier; accent logic is absent beyond inherited brand colors. Anchor Comparison: Compared with Exemplar 19 (soft, unified mats and tuned neutrals), this page lets each tile’s brand color dominate; compared with Exemplar 8, there’s less control of neutrals and states. Score Justification: Due to mismatched whites/mats producing noticeable flicker and multiple saturated mats, Color is pulled down and, with sloppy_images flag, capped at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: Sparse editorial page with a serif italic opening line, clean sans/serif body, and a three‑column list block (Building / Projects / Writing) using consistent small headings and link labels with ↗ markers. The lower 'Now' and 'Connect' sections keep the same rhythm and measure. Preflight: no sloppy cues (no unreadable screenshots, no cutoffs) and low template scent (bespoke editorial layout, no boilerplate buttons). Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display line in italic establishes voice; section heads (e.g., Now) step down clearly from display; small column heads are lighter and slightly smaller than body; body measure ~60–70ch with ~1.45–1.55 leading; paragraph spacing is consistent; sentence‑case throughout. Micro‑craft signals: 1) Comfortable measure and leading across all sections, 2) consistent paragraph spacing maintaining baseline rhythm, 3) disciplined use of italic as display without collisions, 4) link treatment with underline/↗ icon kept to a single tone and weight, 5) proper em‑dash spacing and clean rags, 6) consistent casing across labels. Link/State Audit: Inline links are subtly emphasized and appear to use a unified style (same color/underline/↗ affordance) across intro, columns, and footer. Consistency Map: repeated patterns include (a) italic display voice at top, (b) body copy spec repeated in columns and Now section, (c) small section headings with identical spacing, (d) the ↗ external‑link cue. Failure Theme: none major; if anything, the voice is conservative with limited scale variety. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson – stronger typographic range and documented states) and Candidate_33 (baseline list – looser rhythm). Versus Gavin: fewer levels and state proofs, less expressive hierarchy, narrower palette of styles; hence 4 not 5. Versus Candidate_33: tighter measure/leading, tuned links, and steadier baseline. Score Justification: Clear, disciplined hierarchy and rhythm across multiple sections with multiple micro‑craft signals merits a strong 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A left‑anchored editorial layout with generous margins and a center content column that expands into a three‑column grid for the Building/Projects/Writing block; lower sections ('Now', 'Connect') return to the primary column width. No images or device frames introduce noise. Preflight: no cut‑off crops, no irregular gutters, no mismatched radii/shadows; template scent is low (custom grid, no canned card modules). Grid/Spacing Reconstruction: Primary container appears ~64–72ch wide, with 3 equal columns and even gutters; consistent vertical spacing cadence (roughly 24/32px) between headings, paragraphs, and section blocks; optical alignment holds across column baselines; clear reading path left to right then down. Micro‑craft signals: 1) stable three‑column grid with matched baselines, 2) even 8/16‑based spacing rhythm vertically and horizontally, 3) disciplined margins that hold across sections, 4) consistent placement and spacing of small link rows inside columns, 5) controlled section transitions with ample breathing room, 6) no off‑grid floaters or stray CTAs. Link/State Audit: Links sit inline without breaking rhythm; external link arrows align with text baselines. Consistency Map: (a) same container width reused, (b) identical column gutters, (c) section headings top‑spaced equally, (d) link rows formatted identically. Failure Theme: conservative and content‑light; fewer complex assets to challenge the system. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 16 (similar editorial list with more complex index pages) and Candidate_33 (simpler list). Compared to Gavin, this page is less complex and shows fewer breakpoints/components; compared to Candidate_33, rhythm and grid discipline are visibly stronger. Score Justification: Strong control and rhythm across multiple sections support a 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Off‑white background with off‑black body text and restrained gray labels. Links use a single, slightly desaturated blue and an external‑link arrow; no competing brand colors. Unification & State Logic: Neutral shell unifies all sections; accent blue is reserved for links only; headings rely on tone/weight rather than hue; no value flicker across sections. Micro‑craft signals: 1) off‑black/on‑white neutrals improve readability over #000/#fff, 2) desaturated link blue used consistently, 3) clear role separation between body, labels, and links, 4) balanced contrast—no harsh jumps between sections, 5) subtle gray for metadata/labels, 6) consistent underline/arrow treatment implying hover/visited logic. Link/State Audit: Inline links carry the same accent tone and underline/↗ cue across intro, columns, and footer; states are not shown but implied by disciplined single‑role usage. Consistency Map: (a) identical link color across the page, (b) same neutral text color across sections, (c) zero stray brand colors. Failure Theme: very conservative palette—no explicit hover/visited states shown. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchors Exemplar 16 and Candidate_33; compared to Gavin, fewer demonstrated states; compared to baseline, neutrals and accent control are more tuned. Score Justification: Harmonious neutrals and consistent, restrained accent usage justify a strong 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Hero uses a handwritten/script H1 with a short sans‑serif paragraph below. 2) Section headers ('My Work', 'My Process', 'Recommendations', 'Contact') repeat the same script style with a thin rule; body/captions are a neutral sans. 3) Recommendation card shows long copy in a rounded box; nav uses small caps/regular sans. Reconstruction — Type Scale: Display H1 (~44–52px) in script; H2 section headers (~24–28px) in script; body/meta ~14–16px sans with ~1.5 line‑height; captions overlay on tiles at small sizes. Hierarchy is present but depends on the script vs sans contrast rather than nuanced scale/weight; card captions compete with imagery. Readability: Hero paragraph measure is acceptable though slightly long; recommendation block legible but dense; some overlay captions risk low contrast against photos. Consistency: Script headers are consistent across sections; however caption treatment varies (overlay on work cards vs standard paragraph in other areas), and casing/weights are not systematized. Micro‑craft: Decorative rules under headers are tuned but link styling/states are not evident; baseline rhythm between sections drifts with the gradient pads; punctuation/quotes neutral. Link/State Audit: Only a subtle active underline in the top nav is visible; no clear hover/visited behavior elsewhere. Consistency Map: repeated script headers + underline, rounded containers with soft shadows, neutral sans for body, centered section intros. Failure Theme: stylistic mixing (script + sans) without a clear typographic system; over‑reliance on decorative elements. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are candidate_33 (baseline 3s) and candidate_20 (weaker craft). Compared to candidate_33, this page shows similar baseline hierarchy but less consistent captions and more decorative script; compared to candidate_20 it is more readable and organized. Score Justification: Adequate hierarchy/readability but inconsistent system and limited state/link craft keep this at the competent baseline.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Three‑up 'My Work' grid inside a rounded beige container; each tile is a lifestyle photo with device and small overlay text. 2) 'My Process' shows two diagram cards with lots of tiny text inside image mats. 3) 'Recommendations' is a two‑column block with avatar and a long testimonial slider; 'Contact' splits copy and an arch‑cropped portrait. Reconstruction — Grid/Spacing: Single centered container with section blocks; 3‑up > 2‑up > 2‑column pattern; gutters appear even; vertical spacing is generous. However, content density within tiles is high and screenshots are too small to read; the arrow chip on the third work tile introduces a stray focal point. Link/State Audit: Carousel dots exist but lack clear spacing/affordance hierarchy; no consistent CTA placement. Consistency Map: rounded containers with identical radii, soft shadows, script header + rule, beige gradient section pads. Failure Theme: device‑mock collage with unreadable UI and small diagram images; images carry the story but are too tiny; lifestyle photos with different white balances create rhythm/value flicker. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are candidate_20 (layout 2) and candidate_33 (layout 3). Versus candidate_33, this page suffers from unreadable mock sizes and noisier imagery; versus candidate_20 it has a clearer section structure but the image handling drags it down. Score Justification: Preflight sloppy_images triggered (unreadable device screenshots across 3 work tiles; two unreadable process diagrams; mixed white‑balance), which caps Layout at 2; within that cap, structure is serviceable but not refined.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) Site shell uses a beige/sepia gradient background with soft highlights and shadows. 2) Work tiles are lifestyle photos with distinct color temperatures (warm wood, cool gray fabric, stark white desk). 3) Recommendation/testimonial card uses a desaturated beige panel with a thin border; contact section carries the same neutrals plus a saturated green grass photo. Reconstruction — Unification & State Logic: Neutral palette aims for warm, approachable tone, but imagery with varied white balance is not harmonized via mats or tint overlays; overlay text sometimes rides directly on photos. Accent strategy is minimal (mostly black text and thin rules); no explicit link/CTA state colors. Link/State Audit: Active nav underline only; no clear hover/visited differentiation. Consistency Map: warm beige gradients repeat; rounded beige panels; thin sepia borders; black primary text. Failure Theme: value/hue flicker from mixed imagery against a gradient shell; lack of unifying mats or consistent state colors. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are candidate_20 (color 2) and candidate_33 (color 3). Compared to candidate_33, this page exhibits more value noise and weaker state logic; compared to candidate_20 it has a slightly more intentional neutral palette but still suffers from flicker. Score Justification: Due to sloppy_images with mismatched whites and the resulting value flicker, Color is capped at 2; within the cap, palette is serviceable but not unified.

typography.explanation: Observations: Single, calm serif used for intro and body; company/role stack shows clear weight changes; dates appear in italic with en‑dash ranges; pill CTAs use small, evenly tracked labels. Across the list, copy rags are tidy and paragraphs breathe with even leading. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display intro ≈20–22px with ~1.5 line-height; company names set heavier/larger than roles; dates in lighter/italic provide a second channel; body copy measure sits near the comfortable range (slightly long in the intro but still readable). Baseline rhythm is stable between entries with consistent paragraph spacing. Link/State Audit: Links are not default blue; email uses a warm accent color; CTAs are outlined buttons with consistent label sizing and spacing—state logic is implied by uniform treatment. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated company/role/date triplet formatting, (2) identical pill CTA style and placement, (3) repeated paragraph measure/leading per entry, (4) consistent italic date treatment. Failure Theme: Minor—intro paragraph measure feels a touch long; no explicit hover/visited state visible. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors by structure—Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson) and Exemplar 18 (Paco Coursey). Compared to those, this page matches their disciplined editorial voice and steady rhythm; stronger than template baselines (candidate_9) due to italic/weight system and careful spacing. Score Justification: Strong editorial minimal with multiple micro‑craft signals (italic dates, en‑dash ranges, consistent scale, tuned CTA labels) justifies 4 despite single‑view evidence.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two‑column grid: left column for company/role, right column for dates and descriptions; ample outer margins; vertical rhythm between entries is even; pill CTA aligns under each description with uniform inset. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Consistent container width; grid likely 2 columns with clear gutters; entries form repeatable modules with balanced white space; nav and signature sit on a restrained header line. Link/State Audit: CTAs are consistently placed and styled, signaling interactives without noise; top‑right nav shows restrained, evenly spaced links. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated module spacing per role, (2) consistent left alignment for labels and CTAs, (3) identical CTA position and size, (4) stable two‑column alignment between company and date blocks. Failure Theme: Content is résumé‑like (not many product visuals), and the intro block’s measure is slightly wide. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 16/18’s editorial lists—disciplined rhythm and grid; clearly stronger than generic card templates (candidate_9) due to consistent optical spacing and column discipline. Score Justification: Clear structure and disciplined rhythm across the single view warrant a 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Monochrome neutrals with a single warm accent (email link) and soft gray social icons; outlined CTAs use subtle gray strokes that match text value. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Off‑black text on soft white; accents are sparse and role‑specific (contact). No value flicker across modules; icons harmonized to a single gray tint. Link/State Audit: Accent link for email suggests a primary interactive; other links rely on conservative styling within CTAs and nav—consistent across the page. Consistency Map: (1) One accent hue only, (2) uniform neutral text color, (3) consistent gray outline/border for CTAs, (4) social icons desaturated to fit the shell. Failure Theme: No explicit hover/visited states visible; palette is intentionally restrained, bordering on austere. Anchor Comparison: Comparable to Exemplar 18’s tuned neutrals—clean, unified mats and accents; more intentional than default minimal (candidate_9). Score Justification: Harmonious neutrals and disciplined accent usage across all elements justify a 4.

typography.explanation: Preflight: sloppy cues present (unreadable UI inside multiple device photos; mixed photo mats causing value flicker). Template cues: simple two‑column project grid and boilerplate social‑icon footer (not enough to flag template). Observations: 1) Project tiles show a consistent title (e.g., FutureAdvisor, Streamloan) with a lighter meta/descriptor line beneath. 2) Top nav (WORK / ABOUT / RESUME) and small-caps meta like 'PRODUCT DESIGNER' are evenly tracked and aligned. Reconstruction: Type scale appears to use a single clean sans family; hierarchy via title ~16–18px medium, meta ~12–13px regular; nav and byline use letterspaced caps; leading is adequate and rags are controlled. Readability: comfortable measures in a narrow content column; sufficient contrast on white. Consistency Map: repeated pattern of title + muted descriptor for each tile; letterspaced caps for header meta; nav styling matches footer link tone. Link/State Audit: links/navigational items look reserved (no heavy default underline visible); state logic not demonstrated beyond location highlight. Failure Theme: system is readable but generic, with little typographic voice and minimal proof of tuned link states or baseline rhythm. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 20 (2/2/2). Deltas up from that anchor: steadier caption rhythm, cleaner nav spacing, and controlled letterspaced meta without collisions. Score Justification: Clear, competent hierarchy and readability but no distinctive micro‑craft; set at 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Preflight: sloppy cues ≥3. Evidence: 1) Multiple device‑in‑environment shots where UI is unreadable at presented size (FutureAdvisor desk monitor, Streamloan laptop+phone, Hipcamp laptop+phone, Strava phone). 2) Mixed photographic mats (white desk, wood tabletop, sticky‑note wall, forest floor) introduce value flicker across the grid. Observations: Overall grid is a centered container with a two‑column gallery; tiles align horizontally and captions sit directly beneath images with even left edges. Reconstruction: Likely a simple 2‑col grid with consistent gutters; vertical spacing is adequate but the image handling lacks harmonization (no consistent mats/radii, varying aspect ratios). Link/State Audit: Clear scanning path from top nav to tiles; CTAs per tile are not shown. Consistency Map: repeated image–title–descriptor structure; consistent left alignment for tile captions; symmetrical top header layout. Failure Theme: device‑mock collage with tiny UI and inconsistent image treatments; weak asset harmonization. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 20; differences are minor—this page has slightly tidier alignment but suffers more from unreadable device mocks. Score Justification: Sloppy‑images cap applies (Layout ≤2). Despite a tidy grid, asset presentation degrades craft → 2.

color.explanation: Preflight: white‑balance/value mismatch across tiles (white desk, warm wood, sticky‑note wall, brown leaf ground) creates noticeable flicker; combined with unreadable device photos, this triggers the sloppy‑images flag and Color cap. Observations: The shell is predominantly white with gray/black type; color comes primarily from photography. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): No visible palette beyond neutrals; no evidence of tuned borders/shadows or consistent mats to unify varied imagery; link/CTA color logic not demonstrated. Link/State Audit: Links appear understated; hover/active states not evidenced. Consistency Map: neutral shell used across header, grid, and footer; however, imagery injects uncontrolled hue/value variation tile to tile. Failure Theme: lack of unifying mats/border tints to control diverse photos leads to value flicker and a noisy gallery. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 20 (Color=2) with comparable default neutrals and absent accent/state logic. Score Justification: Serviceable neutrals but insufficient unification and no demonstrated state palette; with flicker from mixed photos, Color is capped and set at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Hero “Hi, I’m Saebom!” set in a clean grotesk with a large, dark H1; 2) Section headers (“Selected Work”, “About”, “Fun”) use a consistent smaller weight/size; 3) Body copy in About is readable with even rag; 4) Buttons (“View Projects”, “Read More”, “Download Resume”) use consistent pill styling and casing. Reconstruction: Type Scale shows clear H1 > H2 > body/meta steps; body measure appears ~60–70ch with ~1.45–1.6 line-height; headings are sentence case; labels (company, years) appear as lighter meta. Baseline rhythm between paragraphs and headings is mostly stable. Link/State Audit: CTAs are black pill buttons throughout; text links are minimal and not visibly underlined—states aren’t demonstrated. Consistency Map: repeated pill buttons, sentence-case headers, consistent grotesk family, uniform meta styling in experience rows. Failure Theme: conservative, readable system but limited nuance—link states and micro-details (underline tuning, hover/visited styles) are absent; occasional playful bubbles (e.g., “Contact Me :)”) read slightly off-system. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 8 and Exemplar 11; like Exemplar 8, hierarchy is clear and readable; unlike Exemplar 11, there’s less demonstrated link/state polish and fewer systemized micro-labels. Score Justification: Adequate hierarchy and readability, minor inconsistencies, missing state polish → baseline 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Long single-column flow with clear sectioning; 2) Project tiles place small UI screenshots inside large, rounded frames over blurred photographic backdrops; 3) About section uses a tidy two-column block (image left, text right) with consistent spacing; 4) Footer and ‘Fun’ gallery maintain rounded tiles. Reconstruction: Grid is a centered single container with predictable vertical spacing; gutters look like 8/16pt multiples; cards share similar radii and drop-shadows. However, screenshots inside decorative monitor/blur scenes are too small to read at this scale. Link/State Audit: CTAs sit consistently as pill buttons on cards and in the About section; navigation affordances rely on these, no visible secondary states. Consistency Map: repeated rounded card modules, uniform button placement, consistent container width and section spacing. Failure Theme: device-mock collage with unreadable UI and decorative blur mats diminishes clarity and harms asset handling; content hierarchy is fine but evidence of craft in image presentation is weak. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchor is Exemplar 8; unlike that anchor’s large, readable mocks and unified mats, these tiles are consistently unreadable and decorative, closer to the ‘device‑mock collage’ anti‑pattern. Score Justification: Preflight detected ≥3 sloppy-image cues (multiple tiles with unreadable small UI), triggering red_flag and cap → Layout ≤2. Within that cap, structure is competent but image handling is weak → 2.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) Core shell is black/white with gray neutrals and black pill CTAs; 2) Project tiles introduce varied blurred photographic backdrops (cool/neutral grays) behind small screenshots; 3) ‘Fun’ section introduces saturated product renders while travel tiles are grayscale, partially helping cohesion. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Accent role largely handled by black fill buttons; no visible hover/visited logic. Neutrals lean close to pure white/black; mats/borders are minimal. The photographic backdrops in project tiles vary in hue and value, creating flicker from tile to tile. Link/State Audit: Buttons consistently black; text links/states are not shown. Consistency Map: black pill CTAs across sections; grayscale travel photos; rounded tiles unify shapes. Failure Theme: value flicker and lack of mat/border unification across project tiles; color identity is conservative but not used to harmonize imagery. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 8 shows steadier mats and fewer value jumps; here the varied blurred backgrounds create more inconsistency. Score Justification: Because the mismatched photographic mats create noticeable value flicker tied to the sloppy image pattern, Color is pulled down and capped to 2; otherwise the neutral shell would sit closer to 3.

typography.explanation: Observations: Across the Column, Webflow Brand, Samsung, Webflow Dot Com, and Archive sections, large editorial headings sit hard-left with generous white space; compact meta rows (role, year) repeat directly under each section title; small badge-like size toggles (S/M/L) use consistent casing/spacing. No default link blue or generic underlines visible. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears disciplined—display H1 (~80–100px) for section names; H2/H3 for sublabels; body/meta around 12–14px with +10–12px tracking and ample 1.5–1.6 leading. Hierarchy is multi-modal (size + weight + letterspacing + placement). Baselines between title, meta, and grid lock in clean rhythm; rags are controlled and never collide with imagery. Link/State Audit: Text navigation in the header is subtle and consistent; links read as understated black text with hover likely handled by weight/opacity (no clashing blues). Section meta lines reuse the same link treatment, implying a single state system. Consistency Map: (1) Big left-aligned section titles; (2) thin meta rows with same font size/spacing; (3) tiny circular S/M/L controls; (4) uniform caption spacing before the tile grid; (5) identical casing across labels. Failure Theme: None material; if anything, extremely minimal link styling may hide states but doesn’t harm clarity. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor is Exemplar 5 (same structural voice); compared to Exemplar 17, this shows stricter scale discipline, cleaner baselines, and tighter label system. Score Justification: Clear hierarchy, excellent rhythm and consistency across many sections with tuned micro-labels merits a 5.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Each section runs a consistent two-zone structure: a left column for the large title/meta and a right multi-column tile grid. Tile crops and mats are uniform within sections; gutters and vertical rhythm are consistent from Column through Ecom Site and Archive & Scraps. No cut-off crops or unreadable micro-UI; even the hero sticky note sits precisely centered with considered shadow. Reconstruction: Underlying grid suggests 12 columns with a reserved left rail and 3–4 column thumbnail grids to the right; gutters look even (8–16px rhythm) and vertical spacing between rows repeats. Captions/meta align to the same left edge as titles, establishing a stable reading path. Image handling shows matched radii and edge spacing; tiles sit on consistent mats with no irregular masonry. Link/State Audit: Navigation is fixed and minimal; section anchors read clearly via the large headings; no floaty CTAs—everything follows the grid. Consistency Map: (1) Left-rail title/meta with identical spacing; (2) right-rail dense tile grids with identical gutters; (3) consistent tile ratios and internal mats; (4) repeated section dividers with identical spacing; (5) recurring S/M/L controls aligned to the baseline of meta. Failure Theme: None—no device mock collage, no irregular gutters, no container drift. Anchor Comparison: Very close to Exemplar 5 (nearly identical); compared to Exemplar 11, this is tighter with stronger mat/radius harmony and steadier gutters. Score Justification: Cohesive, confident editorial grid with immaculate asset harmony across many sections earns a 5.

color.explanation: Observations: The shell is predominantly off-white with off-black text; color is carried by project tiles (e.g., neon gradients in Webflow Brand, darker panels in Samsung) without the chrome competing. The hero sticky note introduces a warm accent but remains isolated and tasteful. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic—neutral background and black text provide a stable canvas; shadows are soft and desaturated; no harsh #000/#fff pairings. Accent strategy is minimal: content imagery provides hue while the framework stays neutral, preventing clash. Link/State Audit: Links appear as understated text with subtle state changes (no default blues), implying a single accent logic handled by tone/opacity rather than hue. Consistency Map: (1) Neutral shell with identical background; (2) soft, consistent shadows; (3) repeated black text for headings/meta; (4) no random colored buttons; (5) tile colors allowed to vary within a controlled frame. Failure Theme: Minor value flicker within highly saturated brand thumbnails prevents full unification to a 5. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 5; compared to Exemplar 6, this avoids large colored surfaces and keeps states quieter—equally refined but slightly more variance from saturated tiles, hence 4. Score Justification: Harmonious, disciplined palette with excellent neutral control; slight flicker from diverse project imagery keeps this at 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large, high‑contrast display headline with controlled line breaks and em dash; succinct small body blurb under hero; section header “Projects” set in a larger weight/size; caption blocks under each project show title, one‑line description, city/year in a lighter tone. About section flips to dark mode with consistent headings and short lists. Preflight: sloppy cues 0, template cues 1 (standard hero sentence). No caps triggered. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Clear scale—Hero Display (~48–56), Section H2 (~36), captions (~14–16) with comfortable leading (~1.4–1.5). Body measure ≈60–70ch; lists in About use consistent label casing. Hierarchy via size + weight (not just bold) and tone across light/dark sections. Micro‑craft: proper punctuation (em dash), clean rags with no awkward hyphenation, consistent caption meta (city/year), link to “Allbirds” uses same face with underline tuned to text weight (no default blue), stable baseline spacing between headers, images, and captions. Link/State Audit: Links are understated (text + underline) and repeat in Press list; CTA “Contact” uses a distinct button style confined to the About area—roles are clear. Consistency Map: (1) Section headers style repeats (Projects, About), (2) Project caption pattern repeats across tiles, (3) Underlined text links appear in hero and press, (4) Spacing rhythm (image → caption) repeats in grid and About lists. Failure Theme: None major; could show more typographic variety/states. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 17 (Nicole Kim) and Exemplar 20 (Rasmus)—similar editorial minimal tone and disciplined captions. Deltas: this page has fewer sections, a heavier display size, and less writing density; still comparably tuned. Score Justification: Readable, disciplined, and consistent with multiple micro‑craft signals across sections; warrants 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Edge‑to‑edge hero image with generous margins; a clean two‑up projects grid with equal gutters and aligned caption blocks; About section switches to a dark band with a multi‑column layout—left photo, right three columns (Services/Clients/Press) plus a single CTA. Preflight: sloppy cues 0 (no cut‑offs, even gutters, crisp images), template cues 1. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Consistent container width; 2‑column project grid with even internal mats and predictable caption placement; vertical rhythm maintained with ample whitespace between sections; About uses a clear four‑column grid on the dark band. No irregular masonry or drift. Link/State Audit: Primary navigation minimized; CTAs appear where expected (single Contact button) and align to the grid; captions are consistently placed under images. Consistency Map: (1) Identical project tile proportions and gutters, (2) Repeatable image–caption stack, (3) Section transitions white → black with equal top/bottom padding, (4) Lists in About aligned to the same column starts. Failure Theme: Limited complexity—mostly standard patterns without advanced interaction/novel structures. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 17’s tidy grid and Exemplar 20’s editorial columns; this site has fewer modules but comparable alignment discipline. Score Justification: Cohesive, well‑spaced grid with harmonized assets and solid rhythm across multiple sections; strong but not complex enough for 5.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral shell (white) that lets colorful footwear photography carry chroma; About section flips to a deep black background with white text and a grey CTA; captions and lists remain neutral. Preflight: no mismatched whites, no value flicker from inconsistent mats; no default link blue. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Palette hinges on tuned neutrals (off‑black/white) with accents coming from imagery; the dark band provides a clear structural break while preserving legibility; links indicated by underline rather than color shifts—consistent across hero and Press. Image integration is strong—the vibrant photos do not clash with the shell. Link/State Audit: Links are a single role (text + underline) across sections; one primary CTA in a soft grey button on dark background indicates action without competing with imagery. Consistency Map: (1) Neutral shell across hero and projects, (2) One dark band with consistent white type, (3) Underlined link treatment repeated, (4) Captions/meta always neutral greys. Failure Theme: Conservative state palette—visited/hover states not evident; the black band is a strong value jump but used intentionally. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 17’s neutral shell + colorful tiles; slightly bolder due to the dark About band, but similarly controlled. Score Justification: Harmonious, restrained palette that unifies varied imagery; minor conservatism on states keeps this at 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Centered hero “Hello! I’m Dorna Mehrkish.” with a short intro paragraph; consistent card titles like “Sapling: Time Off Tracking” and small body captions; primary CTAs in solid black buttons. Across tiles, headings and captions appear readable and casing is consistent. Reconstruction: Type scale appears to use a large H1 (~48–56), body around 16 with ~1.5 leading, card titles ~18–20 semibold; measures are comfortable and paragraphs don’t exceed ~70ch. Baseline rhythm between headings, captions, and buttons is mostly steady. Micro‑craft issues: default link blue with default underline in the hero (“Pantheon”), no customized link weight/offset, and the typographic voice reads generic system sans with minimal tuning. Link/State Audit: Two styles—default blue underlined text links and solid black button CTAs; states aren’t evidenced. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated card pattern of title + short description, (2) consistent button styling, (3) nav label weight/size consistency. Failure Theme: Generic, minimally customized typography with default link treatment. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor is Exemplar 8 (typo 2). Compared to that, this page shows steadier scale/measure and more consistent casing, but still uses default link styling and a generic voice. Score Justification: Readable with adequate hierarchy, but template scent and default links keep it at the competent baseline and cap it at 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two‑column, staggered card grid with pastel mats behind screenshots; centered hero; bottom CTA block with two buttons. Several tiles contain tiny device frames/screens (e.g., Lendmate phone mock; Sapling Preboarding with three small phones) where UI is unreadable at presented size. Colored mats vary by hue and cause visual rhythm flicker. Reconstruction: Grid seems consistent in column width and gutter, but tile heights vary producing a ragged masonry rhythm; screenshots sit in white cards with shadows. Reading path zigzags left/right and the hero → grid → CTA flow is clear, yet the asset handling (small device mocks, varied mats) weakens clarity. Link/State Audit: Buttons are clearly placed; card clickability and hover affordances aren’t visible. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated card structure (image, title, blurb), (2) consistent card radii/shadow, (3) repeated two‑column stagger. Failure Theme: Device‑mock collage with unreadable UI and value flicker from mixed mats. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor Exemplar 8 (layout 3). This portfolio is weaker: more unreadable device mocks, more ragged card heights, and heavier reliance on decorative mats. Score Justification: Sloppy‑image threshold reached (unreadable device frames in multiple tiles + value flicker from mixed mats). Enforced cap: Layout ≤ 2. Final: 2.

color.explanation: Observations: Shell is pure white with black text and black CTA buttons; cards sit on white with shadows; each tile introduces a different pastel mat (yellow, orange, lavender, mint, pink). A default bright blue link appears in the hero. Reconstruction: Palette lacks unifying tints/borders/shadows; mats introduce multiple hues with varying values that compete for attention and create grid‑level flicker. Accent strategy is unclear (black buttons vs default blue inline links). Link/State Audit: Buttons are black with white text; text links default blue—no evident hover/visited logic. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated use of pastel mats, (2) white card shells with shadows, (3) black CTAs. Failure Theme: Value flicker from mixed mats and default link blue; neutrals feel untuned (#000/#fff style) and don’t harmonize diverse imagery. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 8 (color 3) shows calmer unification; here, the varied mats and default blue degrade cohesion. Score Justification: Due to mismatched mats causing value flicker and default link color, Color is pulled down and capped at 2 per preflight.

typography.explanation: Observations: Site chrome shows a simple nameplate 'Sunny Babbar' with a small subtitle and a minimal nav ('Portfolio', 'About'). Project tiles largely contain image-only content (logos, device mocks, posters) with little on-page text. Across two sections/rows, type appears as a neutral sans with conservative sizing and adequate contrast. Reconstruction: Type Scale — roughly three levels (nameplate ~28–32, subtitle ~12–14, nav ~12–14). Readability — short measures and ample whitespace keep it legible. Consistency — nav casing and spacing are consistent but there is no visible caption system; project images introduce many unrelated typographic voices (slide deck, poster, brand mark), so the page-level hierarchy relies on imagery rather than a structured scale. Micro‑craft — no tuned underline/hover treatment visible; baseline rhythm is acceptable but not demonstrated across captions or long text. Link/State Audit: Only top nav links are visible; states/hover are not evidenced. Consistency Map: (1) System sans across header/nav, (2) restrained weights, (3) left-aligned header block. Failure Theme: Generic system typography with minimal hierarchy; portfolio relies on artwork text rather than a unified type system. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8 (basic portfolio grid) and Exemplar 2 (tile gallery). Unlike Exemplar 2, this page lacks captions, tuned link styling, and a visible modular scale; it is slightly less refined than Exemplar 8. Score Justification: Readable and orderly but generic; limited evidence of a robust type system keeps this at the competent baseline.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two-column gallery with heterogeneous tile sizes (slide banner, device mocks, logo on iMac, laptop+phone, angled tablet/phone, architecture photo, poster). Several device frames contain tiny, unreadable UI; the collage mixes angles and aspect ratios, yielding ragged bottoms and uneven vertical rhythm. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing — nominal two-column grid with irregular heights; gutters vary perceptually as tiles shift and whitespace pools. Image handling lacks unified mats/radii; some devices are angled while others are flat, and laptop/phone groupings float without consistent baseline alignment. Link/State Audit: No consistent CTAs or captions beneath tiles to signal interactive states. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated use of device-frame mocks, (2) floating hardware collages, (3) images without captions/mats. Failure Theme: Device‑mock collage and asset inconsistency; ragged rhythm from mixed ratios and unreadable screenshots. Anchor Comparison: Closer to Exemplar 7 (sloppy gallery) than to Exemplar 2’s disciplined grid; also less controlled than Exemplar 8’s simpler structure. Score Justification: Sloppy-image cues (multiple unreadable device mocks, irregular masonry gutters, mismatched mats/angles) trigger the sloppy_images flag, capping Layout at 2.

color.explanation: Observations: Shell is pure white with black text; tiles introduce unrelated palettes: bright orange app UI and brand mark, blue/purple slide deck, black poster, bright outdoor photo. The lack of mats or neutral tints causes strong value flicker between dark poster, black device bezels, and high-key whites. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic — no evident accent/states in the chrome; neutrals are #fff/#000-ish with no border/shadow tinting to unify content. Link/State Audit: No visible hover/active roles; nav appears default. Consistency Map: (1) White page background, (2) black text, (3) color handled entirely by project imagery. Failure Theme: Value flicker from mismatched imagery and absence of unifying mats/borders; no defined accent logic. Anchor Comparison: Worse than Exemplar 8 (which uses calmer, unified tones) and far from Exemplar 2 where mats and controlled grays harmonize diverse thumbnails. Score Justification: Mixed whites and saturated tiles create noise; with sloppy image handling contributing to value flicker, Color is held at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: Editorial hero with refined serif display; project sections use consistent left‑aligned H2s like “Discord Mobile Redesign,” smaller sans/serif subheads, and right‑column meta labels. Later editorial blocks (“Strong opinions, Loosely”, “Uncompromising Quality…”) show large display serif with comfortable body copy underneath. Preflight: sloppy cues = 0–1 (one collage with tiny UI in Airbase), template cues = 0. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Clear scale—Display serif (H1/H2), mid‑weight subhead, readable body, and small meta labels; leading looks ~1.4–1.6 with ~60–70ch measures; titles use cap/lc with careful tracking. Consistency: Heading weight/size repeats across all projects; meta label placement repeats; quote sections reuse same display style. Micro‑craft: even rags, no widows visible, tuned letterspacing in the display serif (no crashing punctuation), optical balance between serif headings and sans body. Link/State Audit: Repeated subtle inline links/CTAs with arrow at the right of section headers imply state logic; not all states visible but treatment looks consistent. Consistency Map: (1) Serif H2 + body pairing across each project, (2) right‑side meta labels, (3) identical spacing above/below headings, (4) footer uses reduced-size labels with steady rhythm. Failure Theme: Limited explicit link/hover evidence and one busy collage reduce certainty. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors—Exemplar 1 and 6. Similar editorial discipline to 1, not as typographically showcased as 6 (fewer state proofs, fewer scale levels). Score Justification: Strong, consistent hierarchy and rhythm across multiple sections with minor gaps in state evidence → 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Repeated section pattern—title block followed by a single large asset; alignment and spacing are steady from Discord to Blitz to Airbase. Hero uses generous negative space and a subtle grid motif; footer introduces a dense glyph grid on a dark mat, still aligned to the main container. Preflight: sloppy cues below threshold (no cut‑offs, crops are clean; one collage with unreadable micro‑UI but not in a device mock), template cues minimal. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Single wide column with fixed left alignment; predictable vertical rhythm using consistent top/bottom paddings; right rail used for meta/links; images maintain uniform margins/radii. Image handling is thoughtful—bespoke gradients for Discord, dark canvas for Blitz, photographic set for Witeboard, angled collage for Airbase—all padded evenly within the container. Link/State Audit: CTAs consistently positioned at the right of titles; visual affordance through arrow/link treatment. Consistency Map: (1) Identical title + subhead block per project, (2) image mats and corner logic consistent, (3) right‑aligned metadata/CTA slot, (4) steady section paddings including editorial quote blocks. Failure Theme: Slight value jumps between very dark Blitz and light sections, and one image collage with tiny elements; otherwise rhythm holds. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchors—Exemplar 1 and 6; similar structural clarity to 1, less complex interaction/layout choreography than 6. Score Justification: Cohesive, disciplined structure with clean asset harmony—minor roughness prevents 5 → 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Warm off‑white paper‑tinted background establishes a calm base; accents appear via project imagery (Discord purples, dark Blitz, light Witeboard), and a dark navy/charcoal footer that still fits the palette. Shadows/borders are minimal; gradients are soft and controlled. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Off‑black text on warm neutral yields comfortable contrast; colorful project imagery is contained by consistent mats and spacing; footer flips to dark mode with muted cyan/teal accents in glyphs. Link/State Audit: Links/CTAs use a restrained, likely custom tone and arrow cue—no harsh default blue; state changes are implied through consistent placement and tone. Consistency Map: (1) Warm neutral shell carries across the page, (2) accent color comes primarily from imagery while chrome stays quiet, (3) dark section at footer remains harmonized via cool-muted hues, (4) gradients share similar value softness. Failure Theme: Some value flicker when moving from bright Discord gradient to the very dark Blitz screenshot; still within control. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplars 1 and 6—tuned neutrals and controlled accents; slightly less rigorous than 6 due to limited explicit state proofs. Score Justification: Harmonious palette, tuned neutrals, no default blue/harsh blacks, and imagery well integrated → solid 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Top nav with small sans serif labels (Work, Writing, About) and a centered intro sentence. 2) A clear H2 'Featured work' sits above two large project images; footer credit line at the bottom. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears conservative: H2 (~28–32px), body (~16–18px) with ~1.5 line-height; nav/meta smaller (~12–14px). Measure is short due to centered single-column layout, keeping readability stable; hierarchy relies on size and weight, not just bold. Consistent casing (sentence case) and spacing between paragraphs/headings suggests a simple but coherent scale. Link/State Audit: Links in body copy are styled as blue (likely default) with underline—no visible hover/visited states. Consistency Map: repeated center-aligned copy for intro and section header; same font across nav/body; link treatment repeated in intro and footer. Failure Theme: generic system styling with default-ish link treatment and no visible state logic; limited depth of styles. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 8 (more tuned editorial system) and Exemplar 3 (looser, weaker type). Compared to Exemplar 3, this page shows better measure and clearer heading hierarchy; compared to Exemplar 8, it lacks tuned link states and typographic voice. Score Justification: Readable and orderly but generic; with single-page evidence and missing state proof, 3 is appropriate.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Simple single-column page with centered intro, then a 'Featured work' heading and two large image tiles stacked. 2) Footer line centered at the bottom. Reconstruction: Grid is a single central container (~1000–1120px) with consistent outer margins; vertical spacing between sections is even (~48–64px). However, asset handling is weak: first tile is a collage of UI panels on a dark blurred background; second is an Android device mock on a light-blue illustrated map. Both screenshots are too small to read, making the content feel like decorative hero art rather than work evidence. Link/State Audit: No structural CTAs or captions paired with tiles; navigation is straightforward. Consistency Map: centered alignment for all text blocks; identical full-width tiles; even outer gutters. Failure Theme: asset harmonization absent—device-frame collage and mixed backgrounds create noise; small, unreadable screenshots; value flicker between tiles. Anchor Comparison: Compared to Exemplar 8’s disciplined card grid, this has less structure and weaker asset presentation; closer to Exemplar 3 in composition quality. Score Justification: Sloppy-image cues (unreadable mocks in both tiles and mismatched mats) trigger the sloppy_images flag and cap layout at 2; the overall structure is orderly but not refined.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) White page chrome with black/near-black text, blue links. 2) Project tiles alternate from a very dark blue blurred mat to a mid-light blue illustrated mat, producing abrupt value changes. Reconstruction: Palette is minimal but untuned: neutrals read as #fff/#000; accent appears to be default link blue; no evidence of tinted borders/shadows. Unification & State Logic: No consistent mat or border system to normalize diverse imagery; link/CTA roles are basic and states are not shown. Consistency Map: same white chrome and blue links repeated; however, project imagery lacks a unifying shell. Failure Theme: value flicker from mismatched backgrounds and absence of a mat/border strategy; default-ish accent. Anchor Comparison: Closer to Exemplar 3’s weak color usage than to Exemplar 8’s tuned neutrals and pastel mats. Score Justification: Because mismatched mats cause visible flicker and screenshots are not unified, and with sloppy_images present, Color is capped at 2.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a large bold sans ('Hey, I’m Robin') paired with a lighter, shorter intro on the right; lower section repeats with 'Nice to meet you' H2 and 3–4 short paragraphs; footer has tiny meta links. Across both sections, copy is readable and rags are controlled. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 2 ("I’m [Name]" hero, left-text/right-image section). Reconstruction (Type Scale): apparent single-family sans; display H1 (~48–56), H2 (~32–36), body (~16) with ~1.5–1.6 leading; measures are comfortable (~55–70ch for body) and contrast is off‑black on warm white. Link/State Audit: only one inline 'resume' link visible; states/underline tuning not demonstrated; nav links appear default-styled without clear hover/active proof. Consistency Map: repeated left-aligned headings, uniform paragraph spacing, consistent off‑black text tone across hero and about; nav/link style consistent but plain. Failure Theme: generic minimal hierarchy with limited micro-craft—no visible underline tuning, no micro-label system, and few typographic states. Anchor Comparison: Closest to calibration candidate_9 (baseline 3). Compared with editorial-minimal anchors like exemplar_16 and exemplar_18, this page lacks tuned link styling, long-form rhythm proof, and typographic states across modules. Score Justification: Readability is solid (sub-factors: Hierarchy 3, Readability 4, Consistency 3, Micro‑craft 2–3), but with single-view evidence and minimal state proof, the score stays at the competent baseline 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Clear 2‑column grid in hero (left headline, right short blurb) and in the 'Nice to meet you' section (left text block, right portrait). Generous negative space and consistent container width; footer aligns to grid with small social links on the right. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 2 (intro hero pattern, left-text/right-image). Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): likely 12‑col with two main content columns and ample outer margins; vertical rhythm uses large section paddings (~96–128px); gutters appear consistent; elements sit comfortably with no cut-off crops. Link/State Audit: Primary navigation (Hello/Work) is simple; no active/hover state visible; CTAs are absent. Consistency Map: repeated 2‑column structure, even gutters, stable top/bottom spacers, left alignment of headings and paragraphs across sections. Failure Theme: clean but generic template-like structure; no complex asset handling, screenshot harmony, or card grid to demonstrate cropping/ratio discipline or multi-breakpoint decisions. Anchor Comparison: Closest to baseline candidate_9 (3). Falls short of anchors like exemplar_16/exemplar_18 where long pages maintain rigorous rhythm and asset harmonization. Score Justification: With single-view evidence and no sophisticated asset presentation, layout sits at a competent 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral off‑white background, off‑black text, subtle light-gray footer band; a single inline link (resume) provides a small accent; the portrait photo introduces natural color without clashing. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; no value flicker across sections. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Palette is conservative and harmonious; neutrals feel slightly warmed; accents/states are not demonstrated beyond the single inline link; no button/hover/visited indications shown. Consistency Map: same off‑black text across hero and about, consistent neutral backgrounds, restrained accent usage, photo sits on neutral shell without noisy shadows. Failure Theme: color system is serviceable but under-specified—no explicit state logic, and the accent reads close to default link treatment. Anchor Comparison: Aligns with baseline candidate_9 (3); lacks the tuned grays, state roles, and border/shadow tints seen in exemplar_16/exemplar_18. Score Justification: Clean, inoffensive palette but limited evidence of systematic color craft keeps it at 3.

typography.explanation: Observations: Single-view page with a large 'Hello, I’m Rasmus' heading and three columns: Projects, Thoughts & ideas, and an About block with two pill CTAs. Lists use same-weight sans text with small gray meta dates. Links appear as text rows ending with arrows. Preflight cues noted: template cue 'Hello, I’m [Name]' hero; link styling is close to defaults with minimal customization. Reconstruction: Type Scale—one display H1, small section heads, and uniform body size; hierarchy relies mostly on size not tone/spacing. Readability—column measures are fine but body leading looks tight and color contrast leans toward stark black/white, giving a dense feel. Consistency—link treatment (arrow suffix, no underline) repeats but meta/date sizing and gray tone vary subtly across columns; baseline rhythm between rows feels uneven. Micro‑craft—no tuned underlines, no small‑caps/number alignment, punctuation spacing and rags are unconsidered; CTAs use a different tone/weight than body. Link/State Audit: Links rely on arrow symbol and slight color shift; hover/visited states are not evidenced. Consistency Map: repeated arrow link rows (Projects + Thoughts), gray meta dates (both lists), pill CTAs (About), and a single display H1. Failure Theme: generic system sans with shallow hierarchy and little state/underline tuning. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor is Exemplar 20; this page matches it closely with similar minimal editorial list and the same 'Hello, I’m …' pattern. No counter‑signals strong enough to exceed that anchor. Score Justification: With limited single-view evidence and weak micro‑craft, typography sits below the competent 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Three vertical columns center on the page with dark side gutters. The left two columns are long lists; the right column has a stacked about block plus two pills. The H1 sits above the left/middle columns but not clearly tied to the overall grid. Preflight: no sloppy image cues, but one template cue ('Hello, I’m …'). Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing—apparent 3-column grid with narrow gutters; vertical rhythm is uneven as list items have varying line counts causing ragged bottoms; the right rail’s modules feel floaty relative to the list columns, and the H1 alignment does not anchor the whole grid. Image handling is minimal (mostly text), so no harmonized mats or radii to demonstrate craft. Link/State Audit: primary actions are inline rows without clear affordance hierarchy; CTAs on the right don’t align to list rhythm. Consistency Map: repeating list rows with arrow affordances (two columns), section headers, and right-rail modules. Failure Theme: editorial layout without point-of-view; rhythm and alignment feel template-like rather than tuned. Anchor Comparison: Matches Exemplar 20 in structure and discipline level; lacks the refined grid or asset handling that would move it to 3+. Score Justification: Clean but generic; limited evidence and weak structural clarity keep layout below the baseline.

color.explanation: Observations: Mostly black/white with mid-gray side gutters and a single orange dot accent; links look near-default gray/blue with no visible state logic. Preflight: none for sloppy images; subtle template scent from defaultish link tones. Reconstruction—Unification & State Logic: Neutrals appear close to pure #000/#fff, creating stark contrast; side gutters introduce a different gray value that doesn’t serve a unifying role. Accent strategy: the orange dot is decorative but not integrated into actionable elements; CTAs are gray pills lacking a clear accent hierarchy. Integration with content: because content is text-only, color could be a decisive voice, but instead it reads as default minimal without tuned borders/shadows or hover states. Link/State Audit: no underline; hover/visited states not evidenced; role clarity weak. Consistency Map: orange dot used once (About), gray pills consistent in the right rail, neutral text throughout. Failure Theme: default neutrals and accents with no state logic. Anchor Comparison: Very close to Exemplar 20’s conservative palette and limited state design. Score Justification: Serviceable but below-average craft due to harsh values and absent state system.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Dark hero with “I am Jiyoung” headline, short paragraph, and an outline CTA. 2) Project grid uses small title + lighter meta captions under each tile; nav is small sans in the header. Reconstruction: Single sans family (Inter/Helvetica‑like). Type scale: H1 (display, ~48–56), body (~16) with ~1.5 leading, captions/meta (~12–13) with lighter tint; casing is sentence‑case throughout. Measures are comfortable (body paragraph ~55–65ch). Baseline and vertical rhythm appear stable between hero copy and project captions. Link/State Audit: CTA is an outlined button; “See projects” appears as a plain text link with a chevron. States are not shown but styling is consistent. Consistency Map: repeated caption pattern (title + company), consistent nav tone, consistent button outline style, repeated sentence‑case labels. Failure Theme: Typographic voice is generic and template‑like; limited contrast between heading levels beyond size/weight; no visible link underline tuning or state system. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8 (typography=2) but slightly better rhythm and caption discipline; below Exemplar 1’s tuned typographic voice. Score Justification: Clear, readable, and consistent, but template scent applies and limits distinctiveness; per cap from template cues, Typography ≤ 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Standard left‑text/right‑visual hero on a dark field with centered “See projects” down arrow. 2) Two‑column project grid with even gutters and left‑aligned captions; tiles vary (dark app screenshots, a desktop monitor mock, collage of white screens, printed report spread). Reconstruction: Grid appears as a 2‑column layout with consistent horizontal gutters and predictable caption placement. Vertical spacing between rows is even; container widths are stable. Image handling mixes bare screenshots and device frames; some UIs are small within a large monitor frame. Link/State Audit: Primary CTA is above the fold; projects are implied clickable through image/caption pairing (no explicit affordances shown). Consistency Map: repeated two‑column rhythm, uniform caption placement, consistent left alignment of titles, repeated drop‑shadow/mat treatment on a subset of tiles. Failure Theme: Template structure without strong POV; mixed asset treatments (device frame vs. raw screens vs. print spreads) cause value rhythm flicker, and some UI images are too small to read inside frames. Anchor Comparison: Very close to Exemplar 8 (layout=3) and weaker than Exemplar 3/11’s tighter asset harmonization. Score Justification: Clear, serviceable grid but not elevated; template scent cap enforces Layout ≤ 3.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) Dark green/charcoal hero with off‑white text. 2) Content area returns to white/very light gray with mixed‑value tiles (dark UI screenshots, gray mats, white collages, colorful print spreads). Reconstruction: Palette is neutral‑forward; the hero delivers identity via a deep green, while the rest relies on light neutrals. Accent roles are minimal; button uses stroke/white text on dark. Neutrals seem slightly off‑black/off‑white (not pure), aiding readability. Link/State Audit: No explicit hover/visited colors shown; CTA contrast is adequate. Consistency Map: repeated gray caption tint, repeated neutral mats, restrained use of accent color confined to hero. Failure Theme: Value flicker from heterogeneous tile backgrounds (dark screens, gray monitor mats, white collages) without unifying border/shadow logic; no clear link/CTA color system beyond the hero. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 8 (color=3); below Exemplar 1/6 where mats and neutrals unify mixed imagery. Score Justification: Adequate harmony with a tasteful hero, but inconsistent asset backgrounds keep it at the competent baseline.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large all‑caps hero 'TAYLOR CHE' with a small subtitle; slim top nav (WORK/PLAY/ABOUT); three project tiles each with a left‑aligned caption (title + one‑line description + date); footer with 'Let’s chat!' and contact links. Reconstruction: Type Scale shows a clear H1 (very large, tracked uppercase), H2/H3 absent, body/meta captions appear ~12–14px with adequate leading; nav labels are compact. Readability is acceptable given short copy; measures are within a narrow column. Consistency: captions repeat the same style across all three tiles; nav and footer maintain the same sans voice. Link/State Audit: link treatments (LinkedIn/Instagram/Email) appear defaultish with no visible hover/active states; project tiles have no explicit CTA styling. Consistency Map: repeated caption format under each project; same nav style across header/footer; same sans family throughout. Failure Theme: hierarchy relies mostly on size/weight with minimal nuanced roles; link/CTA states are missing; micro‑craft such as underline tuning/baseline rhythm is not demonstrated across varied content. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 8 and 19—those show comparable baseline type, but their link/label discipline and body measures are slightly stronger. Score Justification: Readable and coherent but generic and light on states/micro‑craft, so a competent 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Centered hero block with decorative strip; a single column of three large project tiles; each tile uses collage-style mats (paper textures, tape) with embedded screenshots (mobile devices, a handheld deck, a UCLA web UI). Footer has two simple columns. Reconstruction: Basic one‑column grid with generous vertical spacing; images vary in height and contain extra decorative elements that extend the visual field; captions align left under each image. Link/State Audit: No clear CTA affordances; tiles likely clickable but states are not apparent. Consistency Map: same container width for all tiles; caption placement consistent; nav and footer alignment consistent. Failure Theme: asset handling—two tiles contain tiny, unreadable UI within device frames/collages; varied textured mats produce rhythm and value flicker; screenshots are not harmonized (sizes, contexts, and mats differ). Anchor Comparison: Compared to Exemplar 19 (clean, unified tiles) this is less disciplined in asset presentation and readability; closer to the 2-level anchors where device mocks are too small. Score Justification: ≥3 sloppy cues (tiny unreadable device UIs in first two tiles and mismatched mats causing value flicker) trigger the sloppy_images flag and cap Layout at 2; the underlying grid is serviceable but not enough to overcome the cap.

color.explanation: Observations: Deep maroon hero, green patterned divider; each project tile brings its own textured background (beige/green/maroon mixes); UI screenshots add additional brand colors. Reconstruction: No clear accent/state system; neutrals are plain off‑white with dark text; color roles shift per tile due to collage treatments. Link/State Audit: Links in footer use defaultish styling with no visible hover/visited differentiation; project tiles lack a defined hover/active color language. Consistency Map: repeated use of textured mats and tape motifs, but the hues/values vary significantly; captions stay neutral. Failure Theme: value flicker from mixed mats/whites and competing saturated surfaces; lack of unifying neutral or border/shadow logic to harmonize screenshots. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 19 shows tuned neutrals that unify varied content; here, the collage approach increases noise and reduces cohesion. Score Justification: Because mismatched mats/whites drive visible flicker and states are undefined, Color is capped at 2 by the sloppy_images condition.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a large, well‑tracked grotesk with comfortable leading; project blocks repeat a clear trio—small company label, medium title, light meta line. Body copy under each project keeps a steady measure and line height. No widows/orphans or raggy paragraphs visible. Preflight: no sloppy cues; one light template cue ('I'm [Name]' hero) but below threshold. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears to be a disciplined system (Hero ≈ 48–56, H2 ≈ 24–28, body ≈ 16–18, meta ≈ 13–14). Leading sits ~1.35–1.5 for body, tighter for headlines without collisions; consistent sentence case across sections. Baseline rhythm stays stable from hero through project blocks. Link/State Audit: Links are understated (e.g., 'See All Work') with a custom tone rather than default blue; CTAs are minimal and consistent. Consistency Map: (1) Company label style above each project, (2) Title + one‑line description pattern, (3) Identical spacing above/below images, (4) Reused small glyph for company/section label. Failure Theme: Slightly safe voice; hero line breaks feel template‑ish rather than authored, but execution is polished. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors—Exemplar 6 and Exemplar 1. Similar disciplined scale and clean body rhythm; better than Exemplar 19 which is more generic. Deltas vs Exemplar 6: fewer expressive type accents, less editorial play; vs Exemplar 1: comparable rhythm and casing, slightly less distinctive display tone. Score Justification: Clear, consistent hierarchy and tuned measures across multiple sections warrant a 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Single wide column with consistent container width; section header 'Selected work' anchors the grid. Each project follows a repeatable layout: large asset tile with generous mats and soft shadow, paired with label/title/summary. Images have consistent padding and do not clip; device/render angles vary but keep equal margins. Preflight: no cut‑off crops, no unreadable micro‑UI at presented size, no irregular gutters. Reconstruction: Grid appears 1-column with strong vertical rhythm (~64–96px between blocks) and even internal gutters around image frames. Captions/labels align to the same left edge; scan path is linear and calm. Link/State Audit: Section‑level link ('See All Work') placed consistently in the right corner, visually subordinate; no rogue buttons breaking the grid. Consistency Map: (1) Identical project block scaffold, (2) Repeated label placement above titles, (3) Uniform image mats/shadows, (4) Consistent left alignment of text and assets. Failure Theme: Minor template scent in the hero (centered headline) and conservative single‑column structure; otherwise refined. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors—Exemplar 6 and Exemplar 1 which both show cohesive, well‑paced long pages. This portfolio matches their alignment discipline; more refined than Exemplar 19's lighter tile system. Score Justification: Harmonized assets and disciplined spacing across a long scroll meet the criteria for a strong 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral shell with off‑black text and soft gray dividers; subtle accent use (coral contact pill; gentle link tone). Screens vary in content color but are unified by white/near‑white mats and consistent, soft shadows. No harsh #000/#fff pairings or default blue underlines. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic—neutrals are tuned; accents are sparse and role‑based (nav/contact, small links). Images sit on pale, consistent backgrounds; values are balanced so no tile overpowers another. Link/State Audit: Links appear in a controlled blue/gray tone with consistent weight; CTAs are minimal and carry the accent color sparingly. Consistency Map: (1) White/very light gray mats on all screenshots, (2) Single accent reused in nav and small links, (3) Identical shadow value across tiles, (4) Desaturated, clean neutrals throughout. Failure Theme: Palette is safe rather than characterful; minimal state variety shown. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 6 and Exemplar 1 where neutrals and controlled accents unify diverse imagery; more intentional than Exemplar 19’s softer pastels. Score Justification: Harmonious palette and good value control across many assets merits a 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a large display sans with a blurred-shadow treatment; right column intro uses a smaller, regular-weight sans with comfortable leading. Project cards repeat a clear pattern: title (semibold), one-paragraph description (regular), meta row with company • type • year, plus an uppercase status pill (tracked). Across several rows (First Draft relaunch, Notifications, ChromeOS PWA; Move management, MI scheduler) the hierarchy and sizes are consistent. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 1 ("Hello, I'm [Name]" hero). Reconstruction: Type scale appears disciplined—Display (~96–120), H2 card titles (~20–22), body (~14–16 with 1.45–1.6 leading), meta (~12–13 with reduced contrast). Sentence case throughout; status pills use uppercase with extra letter-spacing. Measures are comfortable and rags controlled; no widows/orphans visible. Baselines between title/desc/meta look steady. Link/State Audit: Navigation shows an active state via a soft gray pill for "Work"; cards imply clickability via image hover (not visible here) and consistent title weight; footer social icons are unified. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated status pill styling, (2) dot-separated meta line formatting, (3) consistent title/description spacing, (4) uniform nav pill treatment. Failure Theme: Minor—hero blur effect slightly trades clarity for flair; otherwise hierarchy remains strong. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 19 (clean card grid with tuned type) and Exemplar 5 (highly refined editorial system). Compared to Exemplar 5, this page has fewer custom link/underline details and less typographic voice, but it’s more refined than mid-level grids. Score Justification: Clear multi-level hierarchy, readable measures, and consistent styling across many cards merit a strong 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Structured two-column hero (left display heading, right bio card). Below, a 3-column card grid exhibits even gutters, stable alignment, and consistent card radii and mats across many tiles (e.g., Octoshop, Account settings, Museum AR/VR; NFT gallery, Menti, Design system). No chopped crops or ragged gutters; captions align uniformly under thumbnails. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 1 (hero intro pattern). Reconstruction: Likely 12-col grid with 3-up cards, balanced outer margins, and 24–32px gutters; vertical rhythm between title/desc/meta is repeated throughout. Card image ratios vary slightly but internal padding, corner radii, and caption blocks standardize the set. Header nav is clear with spaced items; footer aligns to the grid. Link/State Audit: Active nav pill is clear; cards read as primary affordances with stable caption blocks indicating content; no floating, off-grid CTAs. Consistency Map: (1) Identical card radii and padding, (2) fixed caption block structure, (3) uniform gutter rhythm between rows, (4) consistent hero-to-grid sectional spacing. Failure Theme: Minor masonry variance in card heights causes light vertical rhythm flicker, but alignment lines remain strong. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 19’s disciplined 3-up project grid; less experimental than Exemplar 5 but still controlled. Score Justification: Cohesive grid, disciplined spacing, and harmonized assets across numerous cards justify a 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Shell uses tuned warm-gray backgrounds and off-black text; nav active pill is a subtle gray; status pills are low-contrast neutrals. Thumbnails employ varied but mostly muted mats (lavender, forest, mustard, sky, pink, olive) that feel curated rather than random. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0. Reconstruction: Neutrals appear slightly desaturated (not pure #000/#fff), aiding readability. Accent strategy is conservative—emphasis via mats and the active nav pill rather than loud brand colors. Despite broad tile hues, values are controlled to prevent harsh jumps; shadows (if any) are minimal. Link/State Audit: Active nav coloring provides state logic; footer icons sit quietly. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated neutral status pill, (2) stable off-black text across all sections, (3) consistent gray background tying colorful mats together, (4) value-controlled mats preventing clash. Failure Theme: Some value flicker from brighter mats (e.g., orange, deep green) adjacent to pastels, but the neutral shell contains it. Anchor Comparison: Closer to Exemplar 19’s muted shell + colorful thumbnails; not as perfectly unified as Exemplar 5, which uses stricter value control. Score Justification: Harmonious palette with tuned neutrals and restrained accents across many tiles earns a 4.
